alert.note: Alert for Greeley; Howard; Merrick; Nance; Polk; Sherman; Valley (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 09 at 3:42AM CST until March 10 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM THIS MORNING TO 6 PM CST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches with a few localized 4 inch amounts possible. * WHERE...Portions of central and east central Nebraska generally along and north of Highway 92. * WHEN...From 9 AM this morning to 6 PM CST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions with reduced visibility. Most of the expected snow will fall this afternoon into tonight, which could impact the Thursday morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The wind will generally be northeasterly at around 15 mph with gusts of 20 to 25 mph. Therefore, some blowing and drifting snow will also be likely. In addition, Thursday morning wind chill values will likely fall to around zero to 5 below zero creating a dangerous situation for anyone that becomes stranded outdoors.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Greeley; Howard; Merrick; Nance; Polk; Sherman; Valley
